READ MORE MIT Maritime Consortium A new international collaboration unites MIT and maritime industry leaders to develop nuclear propulsion technologies, alternative fuels, data-powered strategies for operation, and more. READ MORE Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions Learn to uncover data’s true value and make data-driven business decisions with MIT faculty and mentorship from industry practitioners. READ MORE Institute for Data, Systems, and Society (IDSS) is committed to addressing complex societal challenges by advancing education and research at the intersection of statistics, data science, information and decision systems, and social sciences. MORE News MIT News | November 24, 2025 New AI agent learns to use CAD to create 3D objects from sketches The virtual VideoCAD tool, developed by researchers including IDSS faculty Faez Ahmed, could boost designers’ productivity and help train engineers learning computer-aided design. VoxDev | November 19, 2025 Can development aid counter insurgencies? Lessons from Afghanistan Evidence suggests aid programs can be effective when insurgencies are locally driven, but may be detrimental when insurgents don't rely on local populations for support, say researchers including IDSS Director Fotini Christia. MIT News | November 18, 2025 Bigger datasets aren’t always better MIT researchers including IDSS faculty Saurabh Amin and Asu Ozdaglar developed a way to identify the smallest dataset that guarantees optimal solutions to complex problems. TPP News | November 7, 2025 Exploring Market Opportunities for Ancillary Services in India’s Renewable Energy Sector Supported by the MISTI India program, TPP student Grant Lee explored how ReNew, one of India’s largest renewable energy producers, can strategically participate in the newly opened ancillary services market.
